question: Will Donald Trump say "Biden" in an address before a joint session of the US Congress on March 4, 2025
description: Washington Post: [Johnson invites Trump to address joint session of Congress](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2025_Donald_Trump_speech_to_a_joint_session_of_Congress)
fine_print: If this does not happen for any reason, whether because Trump does not say it or because there is not a Donald Trump speech to a joint session of Congress on that date, this question resolves as **No**. Must happen during the speech, not before or after it; for example him saying it while walking into the Capitol would not count.
news:
Here are the relevant news articles:

**Javier Milei Prepares for Opening Speech of Congress Sessions**
President Javier Milei is preparing to deliver his opening speech for the ordinary sessions of Congress on March 1st. He will maintain his regular meetings with his Cabinet on Tuesdays and Thursdays and focus on the speech, which will be delivered in the evening, around 21:00, as it was last year. The speech will be broadcast in the 'prime time' slot, as it was last year, to maximize its impact. The government will debate key projects, such as the Reform of the Penal Code and the 'discriminación positiva' law, which aims to eliminate quotas for trans people and modify the Identity Law. Milei recently returned from a trip to the US, where he attended the CPAC conference and met with Donald Trump, Kristalina Georgieva, and Elon Musk. Trump praised Milei's work on reducing inflation, saying 'I'm proud of you.' Georgieva met with Milei to discuss a new agreement between Argentina and the IMF, aiming to secure an additional $11,000 million to strengthen the Central Bank's reserves and lift the financial restrictions.
Original language: es
Publish date: February 24, 2025 04:25 AM
Source:[rionegro.com.ar](https://www.rionegro.com.ar/politica/apertura-de-sesiones-de-javier-milei-que-se-sabe-del-horario-y-los-temas-que-abordara-4020503/)

**Trump Announces Joint Session of Congress Address on March 4, 2025**
US President Trump has announced that he will address a joint session of Congress on March 4, 2025. According to reports, all members of Congress are required to attend, and all networks must broadcast the speech live. Trump's speech is expected to expose 'all the national disgrace and secrets' that have been hidden from the American people, as stated by the author. The author expresses support for Trump, saying 'Good luck, Mr. President. Good luck.' 
Original language: en
Publish date: February 24, 2025 02:56 AM
Source:[goo blog](https://blog.goo.ne.jp/y-hne/e/07c33f6aaf4260a14071ba1bcb4fd880)

**Top news of the day: February 23, 2025**
President Donald Trump has claimed that the Biden administration allocated $18 million in funding to India to help with its elections. In a speech at the Conservative Political Action Conference (CPAC), Trump also attacked the United States Agency for International Development (USAID) for allocating $21 million in funding to India for 'voter turnout'. Meanwhile, Prime Minister Narendra Modi has announced that he will hand over his social media accounts to women achievers in different fields to mark International Women's Day on March 8. In other news, a rescue operation is underway in Telangana after a tunnel collapse trapped eight engineers and workers. The Indian government has also chosen Atishi as the Leader of Opposition in the Delhi Assembly. The BJP legislature party has met to discuss the first session of the newly constituted eighth Delhi Assembly. The party may form a coordination committee for the purpose in future. The Vatican has reported that Pope Francis is conscious and receiving supplemental oxygen after a respiratory crisis. Tens of thousands attended the funeral of Hezbollah's former leader, Hassan Nasrallah, in Beirut. Israel has scaled up its offensive in the occupied West Bank, sending in tanks to a militant stronghold. German voters are choosing a new government in an election dominated by worries about the economy, migration, and far-right strength. Sudan's paramilitary Rapid Support Forces and its allies have agreed to set up a parallel government. India pacer Jasprit Bumrah received his ICC awards for 2024 during the Champions Trophy match between India and Pakistan in Dubai.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 23, 2025 02:01 PM
Source:[The Hindu](https://www.thehindu.com/news/top-news-of-the-day-february-23-2025-trump-continues-attack-on-usaid-over-india-elections-funding-women-achievers-to-take-over-pm-modis-social-media-accounts-on-womens-day-and-more/article69254651.ece)

**Trump unleashes at CPAC 2025: Vows to 'drain the swamp' and ignites boisterous cheers | Blaze Media**
President Donald Trump delivered a fiery speech at the Conservative Political Action Conference (CPAC) on Saturday, vowing to 'drain the swamp' and promising a bold agenda for his second term. Trump touted his early wins, including the GOP's 2024 sweep of Congress and the presidency, and slammed past policies, including 'giving billions and billions of dollars to countries that hate us.' He also emphasized his commitment to immigration reform, saying, 'We're going to take over our country.' Trump's speech was met with cheers and applause from the crowd, who waved flags and roared approval. He also took aim at his predecessor, Joe Biden, saying, 'Every single thing he touched turned to s---.' Trump left the stage with the crowd on its feet, promising 'this is his party, and he's just getting started.'
Original language: en
Publish date: February 23, 2025 02:35 AM
Source:[TheBlaze](https://www.theblaze.com/trump-unleashes-at-cpac-2025-vows-to-drain-the-swamp-and-ignites-boisterous-cheers)

**Trump revels in mass federal firings, jeers at Biden before CPAC crowd**
President Donald Trump addressed a crowd at the Conservative Political Action Conference, boasting about his administration's mass federal firings and criticizing former President Joe Biden's immigration policies. Trump said, 'Nobody has ever seen anything' like his administration's efforts to shrink the size of government and overhaul government agencies. He also predicted that the Republican Party would defy history and perform well in midterm congressional elections. Trump has empowered billionaire Elon Musk to help carry out the firings, with Musk posting on X that all federal employees will receive an email requesting to understand what they accomplished last week, with failure to respond being taken as a resignation. Trump also repeated his promises to scrutinize the country's gold depository at Fort Knox and to carry out harder-line immigration policies. He devoted parts of his address to last year's presidential race, jeering at Biden and mispronouncing the first name of former Vice President Kamala Harris. Trump met with conservative Polish President Andrzej Duda and Argentine President Javier Milei on the sidelines of the conference, and will meet with French President Emmanuel Macron and British Prime Minister Keir Starmer in the coming days.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 23, 2025 12:37 AM
Source:[voanews.com](https://www.voanews.com/a/trump-revels-in-mass-federal-firings-jeers-at-biden-before-cpac-crowd-/7984872.html)

**Trump Emphasizes Tariffs and Criticizes Biden at CPAC**
U.S. President Donald Trump emphasized the importance of tariffs in his speech at the Conservative Political Action Conference (CPAC) on February 22, 2025. He stated, 'We will take in a lot of money through tariffs,' and 'The U.S. was relatively wealthy from 1870 to 1913 due to tariffs.' Trump also discussed the ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine, saying, 'I want to be a peace-maker, not a conqueror.' He added, 'We want to get back the money we gave to Ukraine, and they should give us something in return.' Trump also criticized his predecessor, Joe Biden, saying, 'Biden was a lazy and corrupt person, the worst president in U.S. history.' He emphasized that he will 'fight' to address the issues left by the Biden administration, including the border crisis and inflation. Trump's speech was met with enthusiasm from the crowd, with many chanting 'MAGA' and 'fight.' 
Original language: ko
Publish date: February 23, 2025 12:27 AM
Source:[아시아경제](https://www.asiae.co.kr/article/2025022309275041559)

**Trump to Address Nation in Second Term: What to Expect**
US President Donald Trump will deliver his first address to the nation in his second term to Congress next month. According to EFE news agency, the invitation to present the speech was made by House Speaker Mike Johnson, a Republican, on January 25. Johnson stated that the goal of the invitation is for Trump to share his vision for the country's future. The event is scheduled for March 4, 2025, and the world is eagerly awaiting Trump's vision for the next four years. Expectations for the speech include announcements on topics such as tariffs, deportations, immigration, and cost of living. These announcements are particularly relevant given the recent immigration policies implemented since Trump's inauguration on January 20, which included mass arrests and deportations of undocumented immigrants.
Original language: es
Publish date: February 22, 2025 09:40 PM
Source:[2001online.com](https://2001online.com/usa/servicios/trump-en-el-congreso-de-estados-unidos-presidente-dara-primer-mensaje-a-la-nacion-202522217200)

**Tool for foreign agencies: BJP jabs Rahul Gandhi after Trump's poll meddling claim**
The BJP has accused Congress leader Rahul Gandhi of being a 'tool for foreign agencies' after US President Donald Trump claimed that USAID funds were being used to interfere in India's election. Trump suggested that the previous Biden administration's move to provide USD 21 million to India to 'improve voter turnout' was an attempt to 'get somebody else elected'. BJP leader Amit Malviya said that Trump's statement 'confirmed' that there was an attempt to influence the election in India. Malviya shared a clip of Rahul Gandhi speaking in London in 2023, where he can be heard saying, 'It's not just an Indian battle...In March 2023, ahead of the 2024 Lok Sabha election, Rahul Gandhi was in London, urging foreign powers -- from the US to Europe -- to intervene in India's internal affairs.' Gandhi's comments were seen as an attempt to undermine India's strategic and geopolitical interests, acting as a tool for foreign agencies. The Congress party demanded that the government should bring out a white paper detailing USAID's support to both governmental and non-governmental institutions in India.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 20, 2025 12:25 PM
Source:[India Today](https://www.indiatoday.in/india/story/tool-for-foreign-agencies-bjp-jabs-rahul-gandhi-after-trumps-poll-meddling-claim-2682951-2025-02-20)

**Trump Urges Congress to Pass New Federal Budget to Avoid Shutdown**
US President Donald Trump has called on Congress to pass a new federal budget to avoid a government shutdown in mid-March. Trump inherited the budget issue from the previous administration of Joe Biden, which had agreed to a temporary budget until March 14, 2025. If new funding decisions are not made by then, government operations may come to a halt. Trump wrote on social media platform Truth Social, 'The government will shut down if Congress doesn't pass a new budget.' The longest government shutdown in US history, lasting 35 days, occurred in 2018-2019 due to disagreements over funding for a border wall with Mexico. A federal budget is a financial document that outlines the financial plans of all government agencies, services, and programs.
Original language: ru
Publish date: February 19, 2025 07:31 PM
Source:[Pravda](https://www.pravda.ru/news/world/2180557-donald-tramp-prizval-kongress-prinjat-novyi-bjudzhet/)

**Trump Offers to Help Mexico Combat Drug Cartels, Amid Trade Tensions**
US President Donald Trump has stated that Mexico is being run by drug cartels, a claim he made again on February 18, 2025, while also offering to collaborate with Mexico to combat them. 'It's sad to say, but if they wanted help with that, we would give it to them,' Trump said in a press conference in Miami, Florida. However, Mexico is already working with the US to combat drug cartels, with the US using spy planes and drones to monitor the cartels in Mexican territory. The US has been conducting these covert flights since the Joe Biden administration, according to CNN reports. Meanwhile, the PAN party in Mexico is pushing for a meeting between Mexican and US senators to discuss the issue of drug cartels and trade. The party's leader, Ricardo Anaya, has stated that the conflict over trade is urgent and requires immediate action. Trump has announced a 25% tariff on Mexican and Canadian exports, which could lead to a deep recession in Mexico's economy. The PAN party is also criticizing the use of the Mexican Congress as a recruitment center for the ruling party, Morena. The party's leader, Ricardo Anaya, has accused Morena of using the Congress as a 'module of affiliation' and has called for an investigation into the matter. Additionally, there is controversy within Morena over the affiliation of former PANista Miguel Ángel Yunes Márquez, who was recently affiliated with the party. The governor of Veracruz, Rocío Nahle, has spoken out against Yunes' affiliation, stating that it does not represent the values of the party.
Original language: es
Publish date: February 19, 2025 06:32 AM
Source:[Excélsior](https://www.excelsior.com.mx/opinion/francisco-garfias/la-zanahoria-y-el-garrote/1700627)

**House Speaker Mike Johnson invites Trump to address joint session of Congress in March**
House Speaker Mike Johnson has invited President Trump to address a joint session of Congress on March 4, 2025, marking his first chance to address both chambers since returning to office. Johnson praised Trump's 'strong leadership and bold action' and said that 'America's Golden Age has begun,' echoing a line from Trump's inaugural address. Johnson added that the Trump administration and the 119th Congress will 'have the chance to make these next four years some of the most consequential in our nation's history.' The invitation comes as Republican leaders meet with the president to chart a path forward on an ambitious legislative agenda. Trump has issued a flurry of executive actions since returning to the White House, undoing Biden administration mandates and implementing his 'America first' policies.

**Trump to Address Joint Session of Congress on March 4, 2025**
House Speaker Johnson announced that former US President Donald Trump will give a speech at a joint session of Congress on March 4, 2025. 'It is a great honor and a great privilege to invite President Donald Trump to speak at the joint session of Congress on Tuesday, March 4, 2025, to share his vision for our future,' Johnson said. White House Press Secretary Caroline Lipton confirmed that Trump will deliver an address on March 4. According to The Washington Post, the speech is a way for the new US President to share their priorities for the next four years and outline specific plans for their administration in policy and economic areas. Trump took office as President on January 20, 2025, and on his first day in office, he signed dozens of executive orders in various areas of government.

**Trump to Address Joint Session of Congress on March 4, 2025**
US President Donald Trump will deliver a speech to a joint session of Congress on March 4, 2025, marking his first address in his second term. Traditionally, presidents give a speech to both legislative chambers at the beginning of their term, similar to the annual State of the Union address. According to a letter to Trump, House Speaker Johnson wrote, 'It is a great honor and privilege to invite President Donald Trump to address a joint session of Congress on Tuesday, March 4, 2025, to share his vision of 'America First' for our future.' Johnson also stated that Trump's leadership has sparked a 'resurgence of patriotism, unity, and hope for the future.' Trump's second term has begun with a focus on national recovery and strength, prioritizing American interests.

**Trump: The Golden Age of the United States Has Begun**
US President Donald Trump said in a crowded gathering in Las Vegas on Saturday that the 'golden age' of the United States has begun with his return to the presidency. Trump promised that 'there will be a significant reduction in American taxes.' He added, 'We have large oil reserves and President Joe Biden refused to utilize them.' Trump also stated that he may 'study rejoining the World Health Organization.' He also praised the renaming of the Gulf of Mexico to 'Gulf of America.' In a related context, the office of US House of Representatives Speaker Mike Johnson said on Saturday that he invited Trump to speak before a joint session of Congress on March 4. Johnson wrote on the X platform, 'It is an honor and a great privilege for me to invite President Donald Trump to speak before a joint session of Congress on Tuesday, March 4, 2025, to present his vision for America First.' Trump had signed an executive order to withdraw from the World Health Organization, accusing it of mishandling the COVID-19 pandemic and other international health crises. Trump believed that the organization acted without 'inappropriate political influence from its member countries' and demanded 'exorbitant payments' from the United States that do not match the amounts paid by other larger countries like China. Trump explained when signing the executive order, 'The World Health Organization has deceived us, and everyone is deceiving the United States. This will not happen again.' The US Department of the Interior said on Friday that it had officially changed the name of the Gulf of Mexico to the Gulf of America and Mount Denali in Alaska to Mount McKinley. Trump ordered the name change as part of a series of executive actions after taking office on Monday, as part of his implementation of election promises.
Original language: ar

**Trump invited to address Congress on March 4, US House speaker says**
U.S. President Donald Trump has been invited to address a joint session of Congress on March 4, 2025, by Republican House of Representatives Speaker Mike Johnson. Johnson said, 'It is my distinct honor and great privilege to invite President Donald Trump to address a Joint Session of Congress on Tuesday, March 4, 2025, to share his America First vision for our future.' Trump's Republican Party holds a narrow majority in the House and a more comfortable one in the Senate. **Trump invited to address US Congress on March 4**
U.S. President Donald Trump has been invited by Republican House of Representatives Speaker Mike Johnson to address a joint session of Congress on March 4, 2025. **Trump: We Have Large Oil Reserves and Biden Refused to Exploit Them**
US President Donald Trump said in a crowded gathering in Las Vegas on Saturday that the golden age of the United States has begun to return with his return to the presidency. Trump promised that 'there will be a significant reduction in American taxes'. He also stated that 'we have large oil reserves and the Biden administration has refused to exploit them'. Additionally, Trump said that he may 'study rejoining the World Health Organization'. He also praised the renaming of the Gulf of Mexico to 'Gulf of America'. In a related context, the office of US House of Representatives Speaker Mike Johnson announced that he invited Trump to address a joint session of Congress on March 4, 2025. Johnson said in a post on the X platform that 'it is an honor and a great privilege for me to invite President Donald Trump to address a joint session of Congress on Tuesday, March 4, 2025, to present America First's vision for our future'. Trump had previously signed an executive order to withdraw from the World Health Organization, accusing it of mishandling the COVID-19 pandemic and other international health crises. He believed that the organization had acted with 'unacceptable political influence from member countries' and demanded 'exorbitant payments' from the United States that were not commensurate with the amounts paid by other major countries like China. Trump explained when signing the executive order that 'the World Health Organization has deceived us, and everyone is deceiving the United States. This will not happen again'. The US Department of the Interior announced on Friday that it had officially changed the name of the Gulf of Mexico to the Gulf of America, and Denali Peak in Alaska to Mount McKinley. Trump ordered the name change in a series of executive orders after taking office on Monday, as part of his implementation of election promises. The Department of the Interior stated in a statement that 'based on the President's instructions, the Gulf of Mexico will now be officially known as the Gulf of America, and the highest peak in North America will once again be called Mount McKinley'.
Original language: ar
Publish date: January 25, 2025 09:53 PM
Source:[altaj.news](https://altaj.news/economy/475985)

**Trump: We Will Have a Significant Reduction in Taxes for Americans**
US President Donald Trump said in a crowded gathering in Las Vegas on Saturday that the golden age of the United States has begun to return with his return to the presidency. Trump promised that 'there will be a significant reduction in taxes for Americans.' He added, 'We have large oil reserves and President Joe Biden refused to use them.' Trump also confirmed that he may 'study rejoining the World Health Organization.' He also praised the change of the name of the Gulf of Mexico to 'Gulf of America.' In a related context, the office of US House of Representatives Speaker Mike Johnson said on Saturday that he invited Trump to deliver a speech before a joint session of Congress on March 4. Johnson said in a post on the X platform, 'It is an honor and a great privilege for me to invite President Donald Trump to deliver a speech before a joint session of Congress on Tuesday, March 4, 2025, to present America First's vision for our future.' Trump had signed an executive order to withdraw from the World Health Organization, accusing it of mishandling the COVID-19 pandemic and other international health crises. Trump considered the organization to have acted without 'unacceptable political influence from member countries' and demanded 'exorbitant payments' from the United States that do not match the amounts paid by other larger countries like China. Trump explained when signing the executive order, 'The World Health Organization has cheated us, and everyone cheats the United States. This will not happen again.' The US Department of the Interior said on Friday that it had officially changed the name of the Gulf of Mexico to the Gulf of America, and the Denali Peak in Alaska to Mount McKinley. Trump ordered the change of the two names as part of a series of executive actions after hours of taking office on Monday, as part of implementing his election promises.

US President Donald Trump will address a joint session of Congress on March 4, according to House Speaker Mike Johnson. Johnson said in a letter, 'It is an honor and a privilege to invite President Donald Trump to speak before Congress on Tuesday, March 4, 2025, to outline his 'America First' concept for the future of our country.' forecasters.initial_reasoning: Historically, U.S. Presidents often reference each other, especially their predecessors or political opponents, when presenting significant speeches before Congress. This is often done to contrast policy differences, criticize actions, or simply to acknowledge prior administrations. Given Donald Trump's history as a political figure who frequently mentioned President Biden in various forums, the base rate of mentioning a political opponent in such a speech could be assumed to be relatively high. Typically, a President may mention an opponent or predecessor about 50% of the time in significant political addresses where pertinent discussions involve parties likely mentioned.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Trump's Previous Speech Patterns
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Trump has a tendency to frequently mention and criticize his political opponents, especially President Biden, during public addresses. As a highly polarizing figure, Trump's strategies often include direct references to individuals he disagrees with.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Nature of the Address
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: A speech before a joint session of Congress often addresses current political climates, achievements, and criticisms. Given this context, it is likely that Trump would address the current administration's policies.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Media Strategy
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Trump's media strategy often involves making statements that will garner significant attention and coverage. Mentioning President Biden could be a strategy to generate media buzz and rally his base.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Potential Speech Constraints
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: It is possible there could be strategic advice from his advisors to avoid mentioning Biden directly to focus on his own policies or for strategic political messaging.
